blockinfo.om_all_outputs_off: Turns off all $t(generic.output)s of the installation. It is advised to wrap this in a separate $t(generic.groupaction), and use that one in a delayed set. This way, the action isn't triggerd by accident.
blockinfo.om_change_shutters: Controls a Shutter or group of Shutters. This will give better results compared to manually controlling shutters.
blockinfo.om_check_datetime:
Check/compare the day/time:
  • Hours are between 0 and 23
  • Minutes are between 0 and 59
  • The day of the week is between 1 and 7, starting on Monday
blockinfo.om_check_io_on: Checks if an $t(generic.intput)/$t(generic.output) is on or off.
blockinfo.om_check_sensor:
Check/compare the value of a sensor:
  • Temperature is a value between -32 to 95 degrees, in 0.5 degree steps
  • Brightness is a value between 0 and 254
  • Humidity is a value between 0 and 100, in 0.5% steps
blockinfo.om_check_validationbit: Check/compare the state of the entered validation bit (0-255).
blockinfo.om_delay: Delay the enclosed set of actions with a set amount of seconds.
blockinfo.om_delayed_set: A delayed set will execute all it's actions on release. When pressed for a short moment (less than 2 seconds), the main set of actions are executed. When held down longer (2 or more seconds), the connected $t(generic.groupaction)s will be executed one after the other.
blockinfo.om_fade: Fades a Dimmer up/down with a set amount of steps.
blockinfo.om_if: An if-block allows logical decisions. Add one or more checks, and make sure to add at least one then-statement. Else-statements are optional.
blockinfo.om_onoff_all_lights: Turns all $t(generic.light)s of the installation on/off. Use with care; a too high current drawn might trip the fuses.
blockinfo.om_onoff_floor: Turns all $t(generic.light)s of a given floor on/off.
blockinfo.om_output_on_with_dimmer: Turns an $t(generic.output) on, in the mean time setting dimmer value.
blockinfo.om_output_on_with_timer: Turns an $t(generic.output) on, in the mean time setting timer value.
blockinfo.om_raw: Executes a Action Type. This advanced option allows use of Action Types not yet integrated in this interface.
blockinfo.om_send_event: Send an Event to installed plugins.
blockinfo.om_set_variable: Increases or decreases a variable (0-255) with a set amount, or set it to zero.
blockinfo.om_start: This is the start; link blocks to build a sequence of actions.
blockinfo.om_toggle_all_lights: Toggles all $t(generic.light)s of the installation. Use with care; a too high current drawn might trip the fuses.
blockinfo.om_toggle_floor: Toggles all $t(generic.light)s of a given floor.
blockinfo.om_toggle_follow: Toggles a group of $t(generic.output)s. The first $t(generic.output) will be toggled, and all subsequent $t(generic.output)s will get the state of the first one. This can be used to toggle a group of $t(generic.output)s that can also be toggled individually.
blockinfo.om_toggle_with_dimmer: Toggle the configured $t(generic.output), setting the dimmer value.

builder.delayset: Execute on $t(generic.input) release: %1 %2 Execute after pressing... %3 2 seconds: %4 3 seconds: %5 4 seconds: %6 5 seconds: %7 6 seconds: %8
builder.noblockinfo: Select a block to display some basic (help) information, if available.
builder.warnnotoggle: Should only contains "Toggle [$t(generic.output)]" statements. At least 2 such statements required.

cloud.generalinformation: It is possible to connect your OpenMotics system to the OpenMotics Cloud. This free-of-charge service adds additional features to the system;
cloud.metricsinformation: To be able to provide historical usage information on the Cloud, the system periodically sends usage information to the Cloud infrastructure. For example, it might send that a total of 3274 kWh electricity was used at 2017-04-23 at 15:45.
cloud.supportinformation: Additionally, it is possible to enable advanced diagnostics, which will send data such as crash dumps to the Cloud infrastructure. OpenMotics can use this data to help investigate issues and improve it's software.
cloud.title: Cloud

triggerInfo.input_CHANGE: Notification is sent when the input changes state.
triggerInfo.input_OFF: Notification is sent when the input is deactivated (e.g. button release).
triggerInfo.input_ON: Notification is sent when the input is activated (e.g. button press).
triggerInfo.output_CHANGE: Notification is sent when the output switches on or off.
triggerInfo.output_OFF: Notification is sent when the output switches off.
triggerInfo.output_ON: Notification is sent when the output switches on.

triggerTypesInfo.input: Notification is sent when the input changes state.
triggerTypesInfo.output: Notification is sent when the output changes state.

floorsandrooms.addingfloorplan: Adding a floorplan to your floor will allow you to place all elements (lights, outlets,...) on it on the 'Lights & Outputs' page for easy control.
floorsandrooms.description: Generally speaking, there will be one item for each of your house's floors, but you can also create virtual floors. Those are identical to the normal floors, but can represent other things like your garden or a wall in your garage where all pumps and valves are located. Once one or more floors have been created it is possible to add rooms to them. During the setup of your installation you will be able to assign each element (light, valve, push button, sensor, thermostat, etc.) to a room which will then be visualised in the OpenMotics mobile app.
floorsandrooms.imageinfo: You can find your current attached image below.
floorsandrooms.noimage: There is no image attached yet.
floorsandrooms.roomsadded: Rooms can be added at the bottom of this page.
floorsandrooms.selectitem: Please select an item above to start changing the attached image.

table.name: Name
table.removeRoom: Deleting a room will unlink all linked objects (Inputs, Outputs, ...). Are you sure you want to delete this room?
table.removefloor: Deleting a floor will reset all placed outputs and cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to delete this floor?

floorsandrooms.tip: Don't leave too much whitespace on the image, but make sure you leave some space to place outputs representing the driveway for example
floorsandrooms.title: Floors & Rooms
floorsandrooms.uploadformat: Upload the image in PNG or JPEG format

initialisation.cannote1: Trigger each input of every micro CAN you want to use before continuing.
initialisation.cannote2: A CAN based Input or Sensor module will be created for each 8 inputs or sensors that are triggered. The micro CAN modules themselves will not be shown in the list below.
initialisation.cannote3: Even if only the connected sensor will be used (no inputs) it is required to trigger at least 1 input on that module once to activate the sensor.
initialisation.cannotetext: Important note for micro CAN modules:
initialisation.discoveractive: Before you can start using your installed modules they have to be initialised and added to the system first. Module initialisation is currently active. Press the Start module initialisation button and follow the instructions.
initialisation.discoverinactive: Before you can start using your installed modules they have to be initialised and added to the system first. Module initialisation is currently inactive. Press the Start module initialisation button and follow the instructions.
initialisation.discoveroncestarted: Once started, press the initialisation button on each of your installed & powered modules and verify that it is added to the list below. Once all modules have been added press the Stop module initialisation button.
initialisation.title: Initialisation

inputs.introductory:
To identify your inputs (push buttons, motion detectors, etc...) you'll need to physically activate each one so it can be named and configured.
Every input below will show for 10 seconds after being activated. You can then select that tile to name and configure it.
If you want to use the same Automation (a sequence of actions) for several inputs you should create it on the Settings > Automations page first.
inputs.motionsensor: Motion sensor, turning $t(generic.output) '{{output}}' on with timer set to {{timeout}}.
inputs.pleaseselect: Please select an $t(generic.input) in the list above
inputs.title: Inputs

outputs.directioninfo: relay {{up}} is up, relay {{down}} is down.
outputs.introductory: It's time to identify and catalog all available outputs so they can be linked later on. Select an output below and set its properties. The Indicate button will make the corresponding front panel LED of the module blink for a short period.
outputs.pleaseselect: Please select an $t(generic.output) in the list above
outputs.title: Outputs

sensors.introductiontext:
Each temperature and/or humidity sensor connected to the system can be used to serve as the data source for your Thermostats or automatic ventilation control.
All active sensors are listed below: select, identify and configure each one. Pressing Indicate will turn on the LED on the respective micro CAN module or Sensor module front panel and that sensor PCB (if available).
Assigning a room to each sensor will show the measurements for that room in the mobile app.
sensors.pleaseselect: Please select an $t(generic.sensor) in the above table
sensors.title: Sensors

thermostats.copytitle: Copy temperatures and timings between 2 thermostats

introduction.global: Thermostats link your temperature sensors to your valves and allow you to set up multi room heating with custom routines and temperature setpoints. You can define a thermostat for each of the available sensors.
introduction.multi: Multi zone heating/cooling installation (multiple Thermostats, each with 1 or 2 valves):
introduction.multi1: Set the pump delay to the time it takes a valve to fully open (typically up to 2-3 minutes)
introduction.multi2: Set the Primary and/or Secondary Output of your Thermostats to the corresponding valve(s)
introduction.multi3: Add all valves connected to the same heating or cooling circuit to the same Pump Group
introduction.multi4: Add the pump or HVAC unit' thermostat contact as Pump Group Output
introduction.single: Single heating/cooling zone installation (1 Thermostat, no valves):
introduction.single2: Set the Primary Output of your Thermostat to the pump or HVAC unit' thermostat contact
introduction.thermostat: Create the desired Thermostats below, each one is linked to a Sensor (defined in the previous step) and can drive up to 2 valves.

thermostats.pleaseselect: Please select a Thermostat in the list above
thermostats.pump: connected to pump or HVAC unit (thermostat contact)
thermostats.setuntilinfo: Please set the date and time for when the termostat mode should automatically be reverted to "Auto".
thermostats.title: Thermostats

thermostats.nothermostats: No thermostats configured. They can be configured at

general.info: Please provide general settings for the Thermostats. The heating will active as soon as the linked sensor drops below the threshold.
general.invalidthreshold: Threshold should be between -32 and 95 degrees, in steps of 0.5
general.title: General

switching.info: This step allows the definition of certain $t(generic.output)s and values to be set when the Thermostat is switched from heating to cooling. This could for example be used to power on the airco units.
switching.title: Switching between heating and cooling

configure.feedbackinfo: Settings related to CAN LED feedback.
configure.lightsoff: An $t(generic.input) configured as 'All lights Off' does not need extra settings.
configure.motionsensorwarning: The motion sensor's pulse timeout should be shorter than the selected timeout above.
configure.noledsavailable: This $t(generic.output) has no feedback slots available anymore.
configure.otherfeedback: Other LED feedback linked to this $t(generic.output)
configure.title: Configuration

feedback.linkedinfo: This $t(generic.input) via CAN supports LED feedback. It can directly be controlled by an $t(generic.output), or it can be used to provide generic feedback (e.g. indicate whether one or more Lights are on).
feedback.title: LED feedback

general.advancedinfo: An $t(generic.input) can trigger a series of advanced actions.
general.groupactioninfo: Triggering this $t(generic.input) will execute an $t(generic.groupaction). This makes it easy to have multiple $t(generic.input)s to execute the same logic.
general.inactiveinfo: An $t(generic.input) is typically marked as 'Inactive' when it is not (yet) in use.
general.info: Please provide some general parameters for the $t(generic.input). The selected mode's settings will be configured in the next step(s).
general.lightsoffinfo: Pressing this $t(generic.input) will turn all lights off
general.linkedinfo: An $t(generic.input) can be directly linked to a given $t(generic.output). In this case, pressing the $t(generic.input) will toggle the $t(generic.output). In case the linked $t(generic.output) is dimmable, long pressing the $t(generic.input) will cause the $t(generic.output) to cycle through it's range.
general.motionsensorinfo: An $t(generic.input) can be controlled by a motion sensor. Each time motion is reported, a linked $t(generic.output) is turned on for a given amount of time.
general.name: Name
general.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 10 characters
general.outputsoffinfo: Pressing this $t(generic.input) will turn all $t(generic.output)s off
general.pulseinfo: An $t(generic.input) that is linked to a Pulse Counter can be used for energy measurement by pulse inputs (e.g. a gas or water meter).
general.shutterinfo: Triggering this $t(generic.input) will control a $t(generic.shutter) (e.g. moving it up). For controlling groups of $t(generic.shutter)s, use $t(wizards.configureinput.general.advanced).
general.title: General

configure.info: This wizards adds an OAuth2 application. This functionality is intended for application developers wanting to integrate their application with the OpenMotics platform, and is not intended for end-users of such applications. For more information about OAuth2, see oauth.net.
configure.invalidname: The application name should be between 8 and 30 characters
configure.invalidredirecturi: The Redirect URI should be valid
configure.title: Add application
configure.warning: Never share confidential information such as passwords or secrets with anyone.

configure.duplicateleds: Certain feedback LEDs have been configured multiple times
configure.name: Name
configure.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 16 characters
configure.timerlength: Timer up should be between 0s and {{max}}, where 0s means disabled
configure.title: Configuration

configure.invalidactionnumber: The Action number should be a number between 0 and 255
configure.invalidactiontype: The Action type should be a number between 0 and 255
configure.title: Specific configuration

general.basicactioninfo: This executes a Basic Action. These Basic Actions can be used to execute anything on the system. It is however only suitable for experienced users, as they can have undesired side effects if used incorrectly. Inexperienced users are advised to use the option to execute an $t(generic.groupaction).
general.groupactioninfo: This executes a $t(generic.groupaction). These $t(generic.groupaction)s can be configured using the user interface and can execute a series of various actions.
general.title: General

schedule.endhelp: Date/time after which the Schedule ends. Leave empty if the Schedule schould be repeated forever.
schedule.info: More information is needed to configure when exactly the Schedule needs to be executed.
schedule.invalidat: The time at which a schedule should be executed should be of the format 'hh:mm' and represent a valid time
schedule.invaliddays: At least one day should be selected
schedule.invalidend: End date/time should be empty, or should be of the format 'YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm' and represent a valid date/time
schedule.invalidevery: Select one of the values in the dropdown for the repeat frequency.
schedule.invalidrepeat: The schedule should be filled when repeat is set, and should contain a valid crontab-alike format
schedule.invalidstart: Start date/time should be of the format 'YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm' and represent a valid date/time
schedule.repeathelp:
At which interval should the Schedule be executed. This is defined in a crontab-alike format.
Examples:
  • Every 5 minutes: */5 * * * *
  • 07:45 at saturday and sunday: 45 7 * * sat,sun
schedule.starthelp: Date/time from which to start the Schedule.
schedule.title: Schedule

configure.invalidoffset: Offset should be between -7.5 and 7.5 degrees, in steps of 0.5
configure.name: Name
configure.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 16 characters
configure.title: Configuration

configure.name: Name
configure.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 16 characters
configure.timerdownlength: Timer down should be between 0s and {{max}}, where 0s means disabled
configure.timeruplength: Timer up should be between 0s and {{max}}, where 0s means disabled
configure.title: Configuration

configure.info: Please fill in all information of the Thermostat. For a thermostat to become used by the system, at least the Sensor and the primary $t(generic.output) must be configured
configure.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 16 characters
configure.notusable: The entered information will result in a Thermostat that cannot be used by the system. Both a Sensor and the Primary $t(generic.output) must be specified.
configure.pump: connected to pump or HVAC unit (thermostat contact)
configure.pump0invalid: Primary pump/kettle cannot be selected due to insufficient slots
configure.pump0novalve: Primary pump/kettle is already in use as a primary/secondary $t(generic.output) or vice versa
configure.pump1invalid: Secondary pump/kettle cannot be selected due to insufficient slots
configure.pump1novalve: Secondary pump/kettle is already in use as a primary/secondary $t(generic.output) or vice versa
configure.sameoutput: The primary and secondary $t(generic.output)s cannot be identical
configure.title: Configure Thermostat
configure.usedbyother0: The primary $t(generic.output) is controlled by another Thermostat
configure.usedbyother1: The secondary $t(generic.output) is controled by another Thermostat

credentials.confirminfo: Make sure the password doesn't contain unwanted mistakes by typing it twice.
credentials.disabletfawarning: Are you sure? Turning 2FA off allows anyone that has the correct password to login as this user. Make sure to keep the password private (don't share it with anyone) and don't re-use passwords for difference services.
credentials.emailinuse: This email address is already being used by a different user.
credentials.insecurepassword: The entered password looks insecure and cannot be accepted (minimum: 2 stars). Use special characters and/or multiple words. Don't use obvious words or standard passwords.
credentials.passwordleaveempty: Leave both fields empty when the password doesn't have to be changed.
credentials.qrinfo: Scan be above code on your phone with a TOTP-application, and enter the generated code it in the input field. Make sure to install a TOTP-application from a trusted/respectable vendor, such as the 'Google Authenticator' for Android or iOS.
credentials.tfainfo: 2FA, or Two Factor Authentication, is adding an extra (different) layer of security on top of the classic password. For example, a device that can generate a code. This means that even if an attacker would know the password, access to the device is still needed before a login is possible.
credentials.tfamandatory: The 2FA code (6 digits without spaces or dashes) must be entered
credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.userfoundinfo: A user was found that matches the entered information.
credentials.verifyinformation: Please verify this information and continue to link this user to your installation.

general.emptyemail: Email address should not be empty
general.emptyfirstname: First name should not be empty
general.emptylastname: Last name should not be empty
general.title: Configuration

discover.beforecontinue: Please set the correct mode before continuing.
discover.info: Before you can start using your installed modules they have to be initialised and added to the system first.
discover.ledsnormal: All front panel LEDs blink: Normal mode
discover.ledsshutter: The LEDs of $t(generic.output)s 1, 3, 5 and 7 blink: Shutter mode
discover.normal: Normal mode: By default the $t(generic.output) module can toggle up to 8 electrical circuits. If this is your intended use no action needs to be performed
discover.shutter: Roller Shutter mode: When in Roller Shutter mode the $t(generic.output) module can control up to 4 electrical roller shutters (4x up & down)
discover.switch: To toggle between modes press the button next to the red programming connector on the $t(generic.output) module for 5 seconds:
discover.title: Output module initialisation procedure

groupaction.nametoolong: Name cannot be longer than 16 characters

installationresetcontrol.info: This factory reset will cause all modules and configurations (thermostats, input & output links, …) to be removed. Note that since all modules will have to be discovered again, physical access will be required to be able to re-configure this setup.
installationresetcontrol.title: Reset installation
installationresetcontrol.typename: Please type in the name of this setup - [name] - to factory reset:
